content.question: For sexually reproducing diploid parent cells, which of the following statements best explains the production of haploid cells that occurs in meiosis but not in mitosis?

choices.label: Separation of chromatids occurs once, and there is one round of cell division in meiosis.
Separation of chromatids occurs twice, and there are two rounds of cell division in mitosis.
Separation of chromatids occurs once, and there are two rounds of cell division in meiosis.
Separation of chromatids occurs twice, and there is one round of cell division in mitosis.

content.answer: Separation of chromatids occurs once, and there are two rounds of cell division in meiosis.
